info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 18 at 7:04AM CDT until May 18 at 7:30AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM CDT FOR PERRY AND JACKSON COUNTIES... At 703 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Nashville to 7 miles northwest of Elkville to near Grand Tower, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Carbondale, Murphysboro, Du Quoin, Pinckneyville, De Soto, Elkville, Hurst, Ava, Tamaroa, Grand Tower, Cedar Lake Area, Makanda, Dowell, Campbell Hill, Vergennes, Gorham and St. Johns. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Paducah. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
